I love Fonda it's one of my favorite places in the city, the Chef Santibañes is one of the best chefs ever, thank you chef for all the delicious Dodd you have created for all of us

Amazing!! So much flavor in every bite. Very authentic Mexican food. Also the mojitos are delicious.
Fonda was awesome. Went in a Saturday with a few friends and we caught happy hour!! Bartender was super friendly and ambiance was so cute!! Definitely coming back!

Excellent, authentic Mexican food! Definitely will be my go to! Very pretty also, and great service!

Great service and delicious authentic cuisine. I have been a few times and enjoyed the duck dish as well as carnitas tacos. Beautiful food. Great tequila selection and the ambiance is 100% downtown Tribeca.

Really love this place, the food is always on point and the drinks are great. Fish tacos will be ordered again =)

Let's start with the good stuff. Place is beautiful. Great for friends and couples. Staff is very attentive. However it was hit or miss with the food. The carne asada tacos were delicious but the enchiladas were just okay. The drinks were lackluster. It may be just what we ordered. I will go back just for the tacos and maybe trying a different drink.
Had dinner here NYE as a group of 4. Atmosphere is great, wasn't crazy crowded or rowdy. Food was  worth coming back for.
Good food ! Great service ! Great atmosphere overall. Staff is super friendly and down to earth. Would recommend to anyone who is looking for a low key spot with great food and drinks !
No comment
Fun atmosphere, great service. Great food! We love this new addition to the neighborhood. Definitely will go back.  We were a table of 10 people and they handled it like pros.

We had a delightful experience at this new spot. We have been to their Chelsea location a few times & saw the new one on IG. Good timing, for a trip to Tribeca to our favorite boutique that has unfortunately moved! but we ended up having a great meal, so the evening was saved. The room is so spacious and modern, a departure from the other spot that is more rustic. Drinks are very good...we tried a couple of new ones before moving on to classic margs and a mezcal cocktail. We started at the bar which is roomy enough for dining, but took a booth. Guac is so much better here...we like that they serve with fresh tortillas and hot sauce in addition to chips. Crab croquettes were amazing even if one of the 3 sauces was too hot for me! Ceviche plentiful. The duck in tortillas w/spicy tomato cream sauce was delicious. My entree was sooo good - shrimp with a creamy lime sauce & green spinach rice. Wow. Staff was pretty good for the first week and had a nice attitude overall. Strongly recommended.

Probably my favorite downtown Mexican spot. I love spice, though my wife less so - and I should note that the last time we went, she struggled a bit with the level of spice here but still enjoyed it and would certainly join me in coming back. Great drinks, friendly staff, nice setting on top of stellar food. Given how amazing the old Blau Gans was, it's nice to see it replaced with a new spot that hits on all cylinders. If they added a kids menu, we would be regulars. As it is, we will be back!
No comment

We have 2 days here in New York, so far it has been the best restaurant in NYC, the food was so good as well as everything else, the service was amazing, friendly, & fast. The waiters were friendly Zeltzin & Hector were nice and friendly.
Was a great place. Excellent ambience and good Mexican food. I ordered the sopas which was great. Right amount of spice for me
In a word...amazing! Great food, beverages and service. This restaurant is right around the corner from my home and always delivers a great experience.

Amazing margaritas and omg love the guacamole and house-made chips! All of the appetizers and entrees I've tried have been delicious. Best of all the staff is fantastic, Marcos and and Carlos are the BEST bartenders and always take such good care of everyone!

Went for dinner with a big party. They were very nice and found us a big table. Margarita was excellent. Good choices were very nice. The taco order was surprising for the price. I expected smaller bite sized but these were nice. Going back.
I went here for happy hour a few times, as I work in the area.  Great addition to the area.  The margaritas and guacamole were very good.

Very solid dim sum restaurant. I love the decor here-- very tasteful and elegant, and their outdoor seating is also set up well. Dim sum is good but nothing too noteworthy. Soup dumplings tasted fresh and had a ton of soup inside, and the skin was the perfect thickness. Service was pretty attentive. However I can't say that anything was too memorable to me.
No comment

I had high expectations for the spicy beef noddle soup since it looks really appetizing in the pictures. Def not as flavorful I thought it would be and was a bit too bland. I had to keep asking for more chili oil to even have any flavor.

I got severe food poisoning from 3 Times. It's the most sick I've been in my life. We believe it must have been from the chicken soup dumplings as I ate one and it tasted terrible, and my husband decided not to try them - he never got sick. I'm not sure if the chicken wasn't cooked or what it could have been but please look into your kitchen practices so no one else has to feel the way I felt.
No comment

I came here recently because I was craving the pan fried noodles but, I also wanted fried rice. I ended up getting both and they made a delicious pairing especially, with the extra soy sauce and hot oil.  Definitely will be getting this pairing going forward.
No comment

I visited this restaurant about a year ago - I believe they had recently opened. Let me start off by saying that the service was not the best. The restaurant itself is inviting and really nice but when I entered to order my food the server didn't even look up. Hopefully it has gotten better. At the time they had a smaller outdoor area so we opted to get takeout. I had the shrimp fried rice which was just ok, kind of bland. The portion size is big for what you pay; I had some leftovers for dinner. I actually reheated it with soy sauce and it tasted a little better. The scallion pancakes were my favorite thing and really delicious. They also gave us red bean puffs complimentary but I wasn't a fan of the texture. Not sure I would rush to try them again.

Love the dumplings and used to order $100+ big orders of frozen xiao long bao and other goodies to steam/fry at home. However, they've stopped doing frozen items delivery. Unfortunately, soup dumplings are not nearly as good once they've been steaming extra in a delivery container as they are fresh out of the bamboo steamer. When I'm in Chinatown (which is a trek for me), I'll pick some up, but I'm sad they no longer deliver. It's less of a regular thing for me now (maybe good for my diet though lol).
No comment

I was here for the House special spicy braised beef noodle soup, which supposed to be chef's Signature dish.  However, the noodle they served was very different than the picture on yelp.  The noodle was too soft and not cook to order. The soup was watery.  I felt like a fool.  The green onion pancake was ok but very greasy.  This is absolutely the worst meal during my 10 days in NYC.

This is a very beautiful restaurant, indoor and outside seating. The dish I had was the Chicken stir fry  noodles. This chicken was sliced thin seasoned to perfection, with julienned carrots, green onions, mushrooms and "Fresh" hand- pulled noodles. There was a small dish of some kind of amazing oil that truly compliments the dish. This was very delicious, and oh NO SOY SAUCE is necessary.
No comment

I don't write review at all but this one makes it. I ordered a delivery pretty late at night (an hour before they close) cause i got home late from work. Never had this place before but always see it pops up on ubereat so i figure to give it a try. Ordered the chicken mushroom chili wonton and the beef noodle. The beef noodle was good, a solid 3/5 but the wonton is under cook and have this doughy taste. First i thought nothing of it since it's my first time having this place, by the 3rd piece i realize there's no way a thin wonton skin can be this chewy and doughy then that's when i break apart the wonton and inspect it. The dough was definitely under-cook which pretty much mean i had atleast 2.5 under-cook chicken meat wontons. I know i ordered the food kinda late but damn, atleast make sure the food is cook before you clock out. Most likely not going to try again.

The rice cake was good, the house special beef noodle was meh and the siu long bao had thick skin and the meat inside was flavorless. Way overpriced for the portions. 2 stars for cleanliness of the store and the rice cake was good. Overall, not worth the visit.
The soup dumplings are to die for. All the food is excellent and the service is excellent. Their Shanghai noodles are so good and all the vegetarian options are also excellent. Highly recommend!

All that and dim sum...ok had to use that. Lovely staff with really well honed flavor palate and only slightly greasy fried rolls. Very Scandinavian decor with a touch of Asian art, but not busy when we went so if you are looking for a good meal without hassle, this is for you.

column3: Lower East Side, New York, NY
column6: Service was bad, food was ok. Soup dumplings bland. Ice cup was dirty, straw was broke, chili oil taste more like oil then chili, please get better waitresses or waiters who are friendly.

Order was wrong and food was gross and sloppy which is bad enough. To make it even worse I found a hair.  Super disappointing and makes me nauseous thinking back on it.

We came here on Friday night, 10:20 PM and been told that dine-in is not available since they closing soon. However, they have their business hours on yelp showing close at 11:30PM and on Google with 12:45AM. So we had to order take out, but the waiting is 20min. And ironically, all the workers are Korean while selling Shanghainese food with Chinese menu. Foods are ok... not worth returning.
No comment

We were craving for soup dumpling so we decided to stop by and try this spot. The staff was very friendly and welcoming. It wasn't busy when we arrive but it did get busy towards the end. They are currently having a promo where if you dine in, you get a free order of pork soup dumpling. The pork soup dumpling are actually pretty good. We also order the fried rice cake with beef and turnip puffs, both are my favorite dish. I wish they have a broader selection of drinks but they just have milk tea or soda in the meantime.
DON'T GO!!!!! Avoid this place. The staff are rude and incompetent and the place is absolutely filthy.

Super solid Shanghainese place with very good soup dumplings. The XLB is definitely freshly made day of with bouncy skin and good filling; doesn't break super easily. Shrimp wontons were good too. Honestly everything was good. Very satisfying. Even the duck was tasty and I thought I wouldn't love it. Cucumbers were a bit meh but likely bc I prefer a different way of mixing it.  Nice setting and super friendly staff. They even gave us a free basket of XLB for promotional purposes.

This spot is very cute and the staff is very welcoming. The decor is modern, it's very clean, and the food is good. I would say skip the crispy duck as it's only a quarter and +$15 but the taro milk tea was soooooo bomb and so were the dumplings.

No comment

Tried this spot, ordered delivery while at work and honestly it was completely disappointing, bland, oily trash. Dumplings were all dough, mop tofu came with  no rice and was bland. Blown away by how you can make mop tofu bland, but by golly  they did it. Spicy chicken wings also bland, some of the worst wings I've ever had in NY the last 30 years. Never ordering or coming here again, go to Spicy Village instead, if you want authentic and solid Chinese food.
No comment

The restaurant is really pretty and clean. I love the interior and decor of the place. Wait staff is nice and friendly. Had the pork soup dumplings as part of the Yelp elite event and ordered some more to go as well. Warm and nice soup dumplings. Nice to go packaging as well
No comment
No comment

Very cute and very clean inside and out. The staff is extremely nice and helpful, immediately running to greet you as soon as you walk in. I ordered soup dumplings to go and did not have to wait long at all for my order, 10 minutes Max. Couldn't wait to get home and try them as they smelled delicious on the train ride home. They were scrumptious, tasty morsels that almost melted in my mouth. Soft and flavorful, I loved the sour kick. My only complaint is I didn't order more. My recommendation, they are rather small, so make sure you order enough or other menu items in addition. I'll be back.

I stopped by and ordered four pork soup dumplings to go. It took about fifteen minutes to make and the staff was very nice and welcoming. I've never gone to their other location but 3 Times is a good choice for soup dumplings if you're outside of the Chinatown area. Also their indoor dining area looked very quaint and clean!

It pays to be Yelp Elite! I really enjoyed being able to try this restaurant out. I had the soup dumplings and they were delicious. The host was courteous and the service was prompt. I'm looking forward to returning for more!
No comment
Amazing shanghai special beef noodle soup! Came back here with a group of friends and they also loved it! The calamari is also really good. Everything is also moderately priced

I really enjoyed dining at 3 Times which offers refined Chinese cuisine ranging from Shanghainese to Cantonese. My go-to dishes at 3 Times are the soup dumplings, pan-fried dumplings, beef pancake roll, beef noodle soup, and spicy wontons.  I enjoyed eating in pre-covid as the service was excellent however I usually just order frozen dumplings to go now and enjoy them in the comfort of my own home.
Came at 10:45pm tonight and it was closed for dine in said only online orders. Yelp says open till 11:30pm they should update it.

The 3rd time is the charm!!!  I was beyond pleased to have received my delivery promptly pleasantly, (and most importantly), with food cooked so to perfection, and presented in such a desirable manner with paper containers that hold the delectable flavors to such an optimal temperature that the food makes you want to both savor every bite, as well as pile it into your mouth in a mist unladylike way!!  Luckily, I didn't have to worry :). Go here, get a delivery  , or take out - do yourself a FAVOR!!

My gf and I had crab xiaolongbao and they taste weird. We knew something was off but we thought it's just the cooking skill. Not until we got home we started having stomachache and then we had the worst diarrhea ever. That crab was definitely bad. Foods are not fresh!
What a wonderful place.  The menu has so many delicious dishes.  The staff was so kind and helpful.  We loved all the dishes.  We will definitely be back.

Popped by on a Friday night with a friend when everything was booked in town and glad I did! They had a seat for us immediately and there was relatively short wait to receive our food - maybe 10 minutes or so. We got the Pan Fried Pork Buns which had a nice crispy bottom and were slightly juicy on the inside. I thought the Spicy Pork Wontons were very much on the mild side but flavorful enough. Our favorite dish was the Sautéed String Beans as it came with a slightly sweet dark soy sauce mix and very tender. The only disappointment was the dan dan noodles as they lacked flavor. Overall, I loved what they did with the space for a casual and chill dinner - very modern, clean, and spacious especially for New York. The decor is a mix of neutral tones and some modern Chinese photography on the wall. The bathroom is clean, always a plus.

I haven't had Nan Xiang in a while so I can't claim this is better 100%, but I believe this is at least on par if not better. The Xiao Long Bao soup is amazing and the pork is really good as well. The Beef Noodle Soup is quite good and the Beef Scallion is very standard. The Sheng Jian Bao though is amazing. Highly reccomended.

I love this place the first time I came, not too many people. Second time I came, was with 8 people and as soon we told them 8 people the manager/senior server was very annoyed, seated us with attitude and the entire time rushed us, put his hand up to my friends when they were talking. I've worked as a server and if it's a party over 7 then gratuity is included but like why be rude about it? We're giving you guys good business by ordering almost $300 worth of food and you're gonna treat us so horrible and rushed. Wanted to have a nice Chinese New Year dinner but couldn't even have that cause people like to be rude. Food was good, service wasn't

SORELY disappointed. I did come here based on the good reviews and feel rather.. lied to. The place is very spacious and EMPTY on a Friday night. The staff was rather unenthusiastic about seating me and placed me directly next to another party even though the place was empty. I had the shanghai fried noodles and the dan dan noodles and NEITHER were "authentic" or delicious. The staff also did not explain any current promotions. Honestly nothing special about the food here. Would not come back. Many other places with better food.

I'm rating 2 stars because the food was mediocre and moderately priced for the poor quality. The pictures of the food are more appealing than the actual dishes. Only note worthy dish were the soup dumplings. The service was beyond terrible. We had to ask for a can of Ginger ale, straws, napkins (all normal request items) several times. If you're near by definitely order DoorDash though -- the worker seemed to be super attentive to the in coming carry out orders. So much so that he argued with a DoorDash driver for 5 mins straight. (Tip your dashers! Their literally out here fighting for your food! Lol)  but seriously the food and service sucked!

Had a craving for soup dumplings in LES & stumbled across this place! Great service & food arrived piping hot. Soup dumplings were a touch on the salty side & confused to why food coloring was added to the shrimp & pork soup dumplings but the pan fried dumplings were delicious!

Friendly staff, easy to find seating and they regularly run specials like free soup dumplings with orders! The food is delicious and diverse. They also play interesting shows and images on the TVs in the restaurant, showcasing traditional food. Love coming here!

Waiter was super nice and kept refilling my water, changed from takeout to dine in due to personal schedule issues and they were extremely accommodating. Not to mention food was great, the braised beef was super tender

Really enjoyed this spot! Their food is a bit more on the pricier side compared to other Shanghai spots. But their food is absolutely amazing! It's not as greasy and very flavorful. My favorite is their Big Pork Bun. It was super juicy and delicious.

Don't waste your money or your time! We only took a few bites of food and had to stop because it was inedible. The shrimp fried rice was OFFENSIVELY bad. There was absolutely zero flavor...and not even sure there was soy sauce in there! We had to take matters into our own hands by recooking the fried rice!!!! The wrapping on all the dumpling options we chose was entirely too thick and as I'm writing this, I'm pretty sure I'll be sick tomorrow.

Great place to go with friends. It's BYOB which is always a plus!  Love the noodles here and the soup dumplings. Friendly service!
My friends and I were craving some Asian cuisine and came upon this gem! It was beautiful, clean, the food was delicious, and came quickly and the price was affordable. Will definitely be back.

Went here for a birthday dinner with friends last week before going out - their food is so delicious, the shrimp dumplings are great and everything has so much flavor. We ordered a feast of dumplings, scallion pancakes, beef with broccoli, kungpao chicken. Also the waiter was so nice,  and brought out taro puffs as a birthday surprise - so kind!! Thank you!

This is a great place to have a family-style meal with a group. Lots of good East Asian dishes for acceptable NYC prices. The soup dumplings were definitely my favorite! At the time we went, there was also a deal where if you spent more than $30 you got a free crispy duck entrée, so we appreciated that extra item.

Really good dumplings. Way better pancakes than Vanessa's. Service was attentive and able to accommodate allergies. The spicy house braised brisket wasn't overwhelmingly spicy it at all. Would definitely return.
No comment

PERFECT PLACE FOR EVERYTHING! Everything was so good. BYOB? And the liquor store is next door? Omg yes! Bae enjoyed the string beans but the noodles were the winner. AND, the service was ELITE! Shout out to Jason. Jason is a real one!
They were very patient while we decided what to order. Delicious Mapo tofu. Excellent Chinese broccoli. Very fresh.

column3: Downtown Los Angeles, Los Angeles, CA
column6: I was looking for a good chinese place in NYC while visiting & came across 3 times. I was not disappointed! I loved their pork/shrimp soup dumplings, shanghai noodles, & eggplant dish! I will definitely come back if I ever visit New York again!
The food is really small. A crispy duck worth of 15 dollars has less than 10 pieces and they were rlly small like a bit small. While the sweat sour soup is like in a small small bowl

Stumbled across this place and noticed "Soup Dumplings & More" on the window. Very clean and spacious vibe. Truffle soup dumplings a bit pricey -- would recommend just sticking with pork soup dumplings since they're a bit stingy with the truffle flakes and the truffle taste is very faint. Decent amount of juicy soup in the pork dumplings though! Vegetable "soup" dumplings had no soup -- just dumplings stuffed with vegetables. Excellent service! Would come again for more tasty soup dumplings!

Take out portions were small and entrees were overpriced. Everything there was meh and for the cost I could have paid half the price and had double the portion in Chinatown.  I really wanted to support a nearly Chinese restaurant that looked clean and spacious but the quality and quantity of the food did not meet expectations.
Incredible soup dumplings! The truffle one is my favorite. The restaurant is very clean and modern. The service was quick and friendly. Highly recommended
This place is so great!!! Love the employees here and the red bean puffs are delicious!! Highly recommend this spot!!
No comment

Delcious food and fast service! The tripe and beef was amazing, pan fried pork buns, radish puffs (make sure to get it, they are so fresh and flakey!!!!!), and dan dan noodles! You can also order frozen dumplings to bring home. We've done that before and they were so easy to make!
Delicious takeout. The dan dan noodles were fresh and a touch spicy, and the soup dumplings were delectable. Will order again!

This place has solid soup dumplings, and it's open late (later than any other soup dumpling place seems to be -- seems like the Yelp hours are wrong as I ordered through door dash well after closing time.) I got almost every kind of soup dumpling, and I recommend the Truffle Soup Dumplings and Sesame Walnut Puffs for dessert. I definitely will come back when I'm having some late night cravings.
No comment

Small Chinese Restaurant with delightful food near Union Square. I had the soup dumplings, Chinese Broccoli and crispy duck. It was all very delicious! Will definitely go back. I'm all about the food.

Kinda sad. Wanted to eat here. They close at 11, and we came before 10... there were a lot of open chairs.. but they wouldn't let us sit. They could only do "take outs" cause the "kitchen's busy". It was a weird experience. The guy was nice but idk, it was just a weird thing.
No comment

Tried their soup dumplings and they were delicious! The skins were not too thick and were perfectly cooked. They were able to get a lot of broth inside the dumplings, and the broth was savory and delicious. There was also a good amount of meat inside each soup dumpling. Some of the best soup dumplings in Manhattan!

Phenomenal soup dumplings on the lower east side. We love it here! Will come back again for more dumplings.

column3: Lower East Side, New York, NY
column6: Absolutely amazing! Very fast service and amazing food. We loved the soup dumplings and the dumplings in chili oil.
The service is fine but the food is not as good as what people says, their food taste like every other Shanghai restaurant in New York . Nothing special

So they updated the menu recently and they now offer a range of stir fries and authentic Shanghai homey dishes vs what was predominantly a dim sum menu. Don't worry the main dim sum options are still there but if you wan to branch out and have some good seafood and veggies with rice it would be a good time to visit. I highly recommend the new additions - salt and pepper fishing and the shrimp. Very fresh and flavorful.

We got the crab soup dumplings, pork soup dumplings, radish pancakes and Dan Dan noodles. During Covid, we couldn't eat inside so we got our food to go. Everything was packed well and got home without any spillage/ drama which was great. The soup dumplings were juicy, the wrapper around the meat was the right texture and they were yummy. I really liked the fried radish pancakes but my husband didn't love them as much since they're not really a pancake but more like a deep fried, mini flakey bun stuffed with shredded radish. I think they were expertly cooked - warm, not greasy, super flakey and golden. The Dan Dan noodles were tasty too. Great neighborhood place, would definitely go back.
Found this dumping spot around the area. The server was extremely nice and courteous. The truffle dumpling was to die for. If you're in the area you must stop by and give this spot a try. A must try
Our family was very happy with this restaurant.  They said Fusion on the restaurant but it tasted very authentic and delicious.
Great place with the most authentic Chinese food! (Yet so affordable as well) Love it that the dumplings are so cute!

One of the most authentic and delicious Chinese/Shanghai restaurants I've eaten at in a very long time. Get the Pork Soup Dumplings, Beef & Potato Stew, Tan Tan Noodles, Drunken Chicken, and Scallion Pancakes. Too late for pictures.
No comment

One of my favorite go to lunch spots. Also I think the food is prepared with cleanliness and seasoned well. Some dishes are a bit saltier than I like such as the sautéed beans but overall I think they do a wonderful job preparing the dishes and the price point is pretty good too if I don't want them to compromise on quality or cleanliness.
Took too long. I placed an order for pick up. They were more than 40 min late from the time predicted. And it was right when they opened on a Sunday. No excuse.
Awesome food!  I'd come back any time!  Perfect for couple dates, and a great family dinner.  My taste buds are glad!

The place is very clean and well maintained, staff are friendly. I ordered the dan dan noodles so I can only comment that the noodles has very bombastic flavors that you can't really forget. The peanut sauce has a unique blend of interesting herbs and spices in it which you could feel it's made with great quality.

Excellent new Chinese restaurant in the lower Eastside. Clean, attentive and friendly service and delicious food. Soup was complex and delicious, but should have been a little hotter. Scallion and beef pancake roll with hoisin sauce was very yummy. Xiao Long Bao was good, not great. My wife loves DanDan noodles and gave these a thumbs up. We will be back  ... perhaps, next weekend  ... with friends/family to share our discovery and so that we can try even more dishes. They deserve a 4+ star rating. Am rounding up because they deserve to succeed.

This is a new spot in the Lower East Side and on the way I get home. On Friday night, it was not too crowded when I ordered 1 Peanut Jana noodles (peanut, pork, egg, green onion) and 1 beef noodles (supposed to be beef, egg, green onion, pickles). Unfortunately, NO beef in my noodles :( Why I had to get a veggie noodle for $11.25 ? That was so sad and disappointed when I opened the container. I may still give them another chance to try other dishes (dumpling,rice) but come on, please focus on the order!
At the end of my meal, I had to take a DEEP breathe because I was so full! All the flavors were incredible!! The service was great too! If I was a local here in NY, I would for sure recommend!

Food was neutral. I was looking forward to the pork soup dumplings and was a bit disappointed. They were kind of bland not much flavor to the soup. I also ordered their fruit tea but was never delivered. The broccoli and beef lunch special was really good and flavorful so all around 6/10
Cancelled my Uber eats order 45 minutes after accepting it. The driver was waiting upside. Been waiting 45 mins and all other restaurants are closed now. F this place.

This place is so cute with really good, authentic dim sum. My Chinese side of the family would absolutely love this place. The servers there are also really sweet. I literally order this 4 times a week. Love them!
Pork soup dumplings are sooo good! Just had a little problem with the dumplings getting stuck and have paper on my dumpling. I'm still going back!

A group of 6 ate here last nights and we thought the food was good. Two hours after dinner - two of our friends got extremely sick and continued to throw up for the next 12 hours. 2 out of 6 people got food poisoning at this restaurant - we got dumplings and they think the meat in some of the dumplings were bad.

When I went there it was right after they opened. I was with a friend and we had dinner here. It's a very underrated place. I've never had such amazing soup dumplings until I came here. Love this place :)
Best xiaolong bao in the city. Gives Flushing restaurants a run for their money. Service was fast and effective
Food is amazing, portion sizes are good, the inside is very clean and well lit, great for lunch or dinner, also great for families.

I have seen videos and reviews of this place, so when my wife and I were visiting the big apple, we made sure to check out this place with the authentic chef from Shanghai! And boy it did not disappoint! One of the Best pork soup dumplings, crab roe flavored soup dumplings and Truffle soup dumplings! The xiao long bao were so authentic with the thinnest rappers imaginable....having been to multiple places in NYC and LA, this place by far does them best! The steamed egg with shrimps was to die for! But what really blew us away was the pork Bao! Doughy from the outside and juicy Flavorful from the inside! With a bunch of waiters that were extremely attentive to you on a Sunday Brunch time, and reasonable prices, what more could you wish for! We are definitely coming back!

Soup dumplings tasted fresh but could use a bit more soup. The scallion pancake with beef was phenomenal; definitely to die for. Service was great; the staff was attentive, kind, and welcoming. Would definitely come again.
No comment
You know a restaurant is sketchy when the description says "Lower East Side" in google maps. The food looks delicious just from the photos.

The LES location just soft opened a few days ago, and I decided to give it a try. Having tried the other 3 Times restaurant at 818 Broadway, the one here is kind of different in terms of the menu. Apparently they offer a dinner option here, which includes many delicious Chinese food. That's was a surprise to me because the food at the other location is already pretty good and they offer a lot more here! My friend and I ordered HK style sautéed crispy pork feet, 3 Times special braised snow beef, Chinese broccoli. I would say the food weren't too greasy at all. Actually they were cooked right on the point! I highly recommend the snow beef. It was so tasty! Would definitely come back.
Fantastic soup dumplings! This will definitely be a new late night fav since it's right by Delancey. Very modern vibe and good service.

Wanted dumplings so badly!  Ordered some frozen fried dumplings for pick up.  A little expensive, but dumplings were very good.  Good for a quick lunch.  Only thing I would add is maybe instructions on how to cook them for those that don't know.  Maybe add on website.   I would definitely order them again.

Went back to 3 times and had a pleasant experience. The servers were attentive and kind, food was great. The moon cakes and noodles with minced pork sauce were the highlight of the dinner. I was a bit disappointed they no longer serve their entree items so the menu is now the same as the location near union square, but food was still great.

Went there during lantern festival for the Ningpo Tangyuan, a glutinous rice ball with sweet stuffings. A little disappointed to see that the LES restaurant didn't have a lot of the entrees on their social media page. I I ordered the crispy croaker rolls instead, its basically fish wrapped in fried bean curd skin. It has a very crispy shell, the fish inside is steamed tender, it almost melts in the tongue. The only thing I dislike is so much oil is used to fry the roll, there was so much oil I could see it dripping. They give a sauce to soak up the oil; which I find in dismay is something like thousand islands sauce, quite thick and tangy, which doesn't help lessen the oily taste of the fried bean curd skin at all. Me recommendation would be to serve it with a sour or spicy sauce in the future?...the Tangyuan were fine, nothing special, I don't think it was handmade, but just be bought from supermarkets instead, but still a decent meal

Amazing place. The house noodles were so delicious and cheap! The shi bing tongs are perfect and huge! Very generous portions. Dreaming of both right now. So happy this place exists and look forward to coming back soon!

I'm surprised at the negative reviews. Me and my friend ordered the pork soup dumplings and scallion pancakes with beef. Both were really good! Our server was super kind, and I liked the venue, it was relaxing. Great service and I would definitely go again.

I live around the corner from this place, have been wanting to try it for quite some time. Ordered the soup dumplings, vegetable dumplings, and a pork bun. Food was delicious, price was great. The staff here is the best part, they're the nicest people around. Super happy I came here and will definitely return again!

I've been here a few times now and I'm in love. The portions are huge and the food is delicious! I've tried the noodles, buns, dumplings, and boba and they all exceeded my expectations. I'm so excited that Three Times came to LES and want to bring all my friends here! It's surprisingly cheap; you get so much bang for your buck here. Very casual and clean place. The employees have all been super friendly and accommodating. Overall great experience and great food - I would come here everyday if I could.
No comment
Great customer service and selection of Chinese favorites. The dumplings are delicious and the eatery space is big and pleasing to be in.
OMG!Food is fantastic!All staffs are very friendly!specially dumpling is awesome!

Loved this soup dumpling gem on the LES.   Incredible service, great outdoor dining options during COVID, and very tasty food - we especially loved the truffle soup dumplings, the friend mini pork buns, and the greens in broth - as well as the iced milk tea to drink. Great portions, incredible value for money. Cannot wait to come back!
The place was nice and clean. Food was okay only, my family said it didn't have enough favor.

Some of the most authentic Shanghainese food I've tasted outside of Shanghai. I'm so sick and tired of random chinese restaurants jumping on the xiaolongbao bandwagon thinking that most Americans or simply non-Shanghai natives won't know the difference. For years I went to Din Tai Fung bc of their reliability and quality but at the end of the day they're just a taiwanese impression of Shanghai food. 3 Times is finally the real deal and actually has better quality than most places in Shanghai. I don't even live in NYC but will happily commute here to get a taste of home.

We came here before going to the tenement museum a few blocks away.  The place is clean and has a well thought out modern look.  All of the dumplings were very tasty as were the specials.  Service was efficient and pleasant
taste good! Must try!! Love it so much! Xiao longbao is the best !I will be there next time!

Information for 3 Times on Yelp needs to be updated. I ate in at the restaurant last night and can attest to the fact that: 1- it's open and functioning normally; and 2- the food is delicious! We had several orders of the pork soup dumplings along with an order of scallion pancakes, southern pork bun and radish pancake. Everything was terrific--especially the soup dumplings--and the service was good too. I'm looking forward to going back as soon as I can.

Simple and authentic soup dumplings and wonton, as authentic as home style, really like this place. The salty duck is a little bit too salty but it would be better with rice. Service is top notch, always friendly and thoughtful.
Superb dim sum, particularly the soup dumplings. A wide variety of other delicious dishes as well, try the duck or the dan dan noodles. Crisp, speedy service and a well appointed small restaurant.

I had the shrimp egg fried rice and it was absolutely tasty. The shrimps were plentiful and cooked to perfection. I didn't need to ANYTHING to this dish because it was seasoned just right. This dish is a must try!

Came here with my brother and his girlfriend for part of our food tour in the lower east side. More than thrilled we stopped in, I couldn't give a better review. The waiters are super nice, friendly and helpful. It's a fun atmosphere with the ability to look into the kitchen and watch them make the dumplings. The soup dumpling and the pork buns are most certainly on my raider for the next time I visit! I can't wait to come again!

I live around the corner and have been wanting to try this place since it opened. The restaurant is very clean and nice inside. The soup dumplings and the pork bun were amazing! Highly recommend 3 times for a casual lunch or dinner!

The place is new in town. We had to try it. The place is very nice, clean and modern. We ordered a dumpling soup and noodles. It was very good. We took it to go but next time I would consider dinning in so it can be nice and warm. The prices are compatable to other area restaurants. Looking forward to trying something different.

I think they must have made some changes or reopened under new management or something since the negative reviews, because they just reopened on Sunday. Very good soup dumplings, and the staff was very friendly and attentive.
OMG! this is my second time visiting here I think they have new rice bowl it was amazing. I would definitely come back with my friends

I enjoyed foods here. Nice new addition to the lower east side neighborhood. Their signature dish Shi-bing-tong is like Chinese version of savory crepe with different fillings inside but skin is more crispy. It was very good. Their dumplings were also very good. Filling and skin proportion was good unlike some other place that  has very thick skin with little filling.  Noodles were quite impressive also. It's different from the usual lo-mien. It's not oily, simple with noodle and topping but it was very good. Staffs were very friendly and they have plenty of seats. I will definitely come back.
This is the place to eat when you are in hurry. They have one of the best buns and bubble tea. Love it. You guy should enjoy it:
The food here is very good! The staff is very friendly.  The environment is beautiful and the atmosphere is fantastic. They also play great music. I'd recommend this place to everyone i know!

What a great little spot! Everyone in there was kind and helpful to explain what options there were to eat.  You can choose to get food from the steam table (think rice entree dishes like chicken adobo etc) or go around the corner on the other side of the restaurant and pick out skewers.  I chose to focus on the skewers this time.  Plenty of choices.  They put your stuff in a basket and heat it on the grill in the kitchen.  I stayed in the restaurant to munch and ordered the cantaloupe juice.  The food took like 5-10 min for it to be reheated and they had a nice Smokey flavor to all the items. My fav was was the chicken feet and the pork  stick.   Sauces are self serve in the front, love the vinegar.  Everything was very affordable- it was 14 bucks for all my sticks  (1.50 each) and a refreshing drink (2 bucks) Will be back to try more items

Drove about a hour today definitely worth it amazing food and such a warm welcoming place definitely look forward to coming back super kind staff that's took great care of us  such a gem in the community wish I lived closer

Great food along with great service. I had no idea this place opened up at the end of August. It was so recent that they had opened. But wish that I knew that in order to get the Skewers that one needs to go from Tues to Sun from 4- 11pm. I went specifically for the Skewers, but was in for a surprise. They had a buffet style of Filipino food for people to choose from for their lunch hour. I would go again, but this time for the Skewers. Everyone that walked in asked about it. I can't believe this place hasn't been opened for so long. With word of mouth I can see this place having lines out their door in a matter of months.

This place is absolutely bomb!!! This used to cost $$$ and now there's a place for Filipino street food at fraction of the cost at other restaurants. My parents had a great time and we were very full after spending about $60 on all the food + drinks! I can't wait to take everyone I know here!

column3: Wilshire Center - Koreatown, Los Angeles, CA
column6: Such good food. Pork/chicken skewers are a must try. I have to get the sisig next time. Incredible service. Super informative staff as a first time trier of Filipino cuisine!! They were patient and explained all the options to me.

Newest addition to the Woodside community, bringing filipino street BBQ to this area. Owner and staff are super helpful, friendly, attentive and professional. Lots of different skewers to choose from all for $1.50 each! My favorites are the pig intestines, bbq pork, longanisa. They have communal grill outside that you can use to grill up your skewers on your own and it is super simple to use! Will definitely be returning to try more skewers!

I love this famous LA store addition to the Filipino hub in Woodside. Every type of skewer is $1.50 and you can help yourself to the wide variety of sticks from organs, chicken feet, sausage and plain beef or chicken sticks. Grab as many as you like pay in the front and get a nice drink or some pancit as well. You have the option to grill yourself but they can also grill for you in the back which we did and it came out splendid. Theres a station for sauce, the vinegar goes great with the isaw while the thick brown sauce is perfect for a beef skewer. You bet I will be back

I really wanted to love this place, but I don't get why its pre-cooked, you grab it, it's cold and they heat it for you. Its so dry and lacking flavor. I hope they can improve and also add name tags to each item so you actually know what you put on your plate. I'll try it again in a few months and see if it got better.

Why the hype over this place? Nothing special.   It's called dollar hits.   But all the sticks are $1.50.  The selection of the $1.50 sticks is terrible and disgusting.    Fake fish balls and nasty chicken feet and funny looking chicken.   And most of the $1.50 options are one piece or if you are lucky.   You get 2 small pieces.  I can go anywhere else that serves meat on a stick Asian style and for the same price get more than one piece.  Even their meat and noodles combination is terrible.  $11 or $12 for a tiny portion of rice and noodles and two selection of meats.  The portions they give you is small.   Not worth $12 to $14.  I can go to other Filipino places and get much more for $10 to $12.   Like I said.   This place is nothing special.   Dollar hits.  Yeah right.  More like rip off
If you want some filipino food and have $$, go for it. Everything I had was good and would definitely come here again to try the rest.

New place , so excited to try. Everyone were so nice and helpful EXCEPT for the woman on the register. Snobbish. FYI, the bbqs are $1.50. Bill came out to over $40 so I very nicely asked her why since I only had 24 sticks n 2 drinks. She says it's NY, everything is expensive, rent etc.  So naturally I said I have no problem with the price but isn't it false advertisement. She said what she said. 37  years living here and someone tells me what I already know about NY. All I asked is put prices so we can know that Dollar Hits doesn't mean bbqs are Dollar each. The only real dollar was the aluminum tray. All in all, isaw tastes good, turon also. Pork bbq is a bit salty for me. Great experience having pinoy street food again.

There's a kind of homey feeling to this place, but for a new restaurant in NYC, it feels pretty "ghetto" (sorry that this is not a PC term). That might be good in some ways, but not so much in others. Even though it's been open only five weeks, the place is pretty messy. Tables were only wiped down once, a package of napkins was just sitting on top of the forks, the tables are arranged haphazardly. The food is ok. Nothing too special or different from "street food" night you'd find at Seafood City and I can think of better places in NYC to get similar things (such as the Queens Night Market). The fresh lumpia seemed like it had been sitting out for a while. Still, this place and its clientele was 100% Filipino, and the food is very authentic and not prettified in any way, so if you're looking for an honest taste of home (whether that's the Philippines or West Covina), it's great for that.

My FAVORITE new gastropub and bar in the LES! The decor is so nifty, and a very cool throwback to the 1800s tenement era. Gotta try everything on their cocktail menu especially the oyster shooters! Food is so tasty too.

What a great find! Felt like we were stepping through a portal and transported from the busy, cramped, and (let's face it) the grime (that we love and expect) of the LES to a mellow, spacious, pristine pub in Shakespeare era London. Excellent drinks, service, music, and vibes. Will def be going back...a top notch go-to from now on. Enjoy!
Tenement is a new Gem in LES! 10/10 drinks, food and ambiance! Lovely staff and great service. Will be back!

Really cute little restaurant. Service was very personable and attentive - one of our appetizers was forgotten and we were given a drink on the house instead, which we so appreciated! The food was good, particularly the seafood scallion pancakes, which were huge portions.

A Korean-Brazilian fusion restaurant?? Say no more! Aside from being two distinctly delicious cuisines, appearing on the same menu blew my mind in the best way possible. I don't know any other place where I can get my favorite Brazilian food (pão de queijo) and my favorite Korean food (japchae) at the same time. This restaurant is in a hip neighborhood of the East Village, close to Thompkins Square and the 1st Ave L train. My small group ate outside at a table on the sidewalk, which was a bit crowded with people walking by and waiting for a table. But otherwise they have indoor dining and covered tables sectioned off in the street. My fellow vegetarian friend and I got a bunch of things to share, including the pão de queijo and japchae, as well as veggie bimimbap and the tofu steaks with veggies and rice. It was all so tasty and filling! You could add more spicy sauce if you like things hot, or eat it how it comes- mild but no less full of flavor! Overall, I left full, happy, and all for about $30 with tax and tip. Would definitely recommend!

I live a couple blocks from the restaurant and hasn't been in so I stopped by for brunch on a Saturday afternoon. Really friendly server who was doing his best to handle all the tables on his own. I ordered the gyoza which was small and cute and pretty good. Though I was charged more for them than what the menu stated which was a little annoying. I also had the Kalbi which is their short rib with onions. Unfortunately it was very overcooked, tough and inedible. And I also had the Pao de Queijo which was decent. I had high hopes for this place but unfortunately it wasn't the best experience.

Cute place! Wandered in while killing time. Super kind and attentive bartender and very cozy atmosphere. Great wine list, and good happy hour deals. I got a small cheese plate for $6 that came with 2 cheeses, a ton of pita, and two spreads. Delicious! Also, noticed on the menu that they seem to have a great brunch . Entrees are $10 and include a mimosa  definitely coming back to check that out.

This is a great place. The food is very flavorful  and well presented. The atmosphere is cozy with original brick wall with candles, and a big street facing window for natural light. In addition to a substantial wine selection they have a great beer menu.  The serers are friendly and attentive and the owner Raphael is a great guy and an avid hiker. Gomi was the name of his dog who also loved to hike, and he has a few pics of him on the wall.

Very solid and affordable brunch spot in east village. It's fairly new, so no reservation is needed, and the brunch meal is amazing - $10 for an entree and a free mimosa. The food is solid (not the best I've ever had but perfectly good) and the waitress is incredibly nice. Great neighborhood spot that I'd be happy to go back to!

$10 brunch, say whaaaat?! I came here with a Meetup group on Saturday and was surprised the place was relatively empty. I never had Korean food before so I was excited to try it. I got the Spicy Chicken Bulgogi which came with a small bowl of rice. It was really good but not super spicy to me. All brunch entrees also come with a free mimosa so it's a fantastic deal! That being said, if you're looking for traditional brunch items, you won't find that here. It's more lunch than anything else. Also, I'm not sure why they have Brazilian food; I feel like they should just stick to one cuisine. But that being said, I enjoyed my meal here. Great value!

The owner is unbelievably knowledgeable about wine and manages to teach you while you're here without ever sounding patronizing or preachy, as so many wine connoisseurs do. He listens to your preferences and gets you exactly what you want even when you didn't know what you were looking for. Other restaurant owners pls take note

Very cute wine bar set in quiet part of East  Village. The owner was super nice here. We came here for their $10 brunch special which also comes with free mimosa's! How awesome is that? Their brunch menu isn't your typical brunch food and is more of a Korean grilled lunch kinda food style. We ordered one with pork and one with beef. The main difference between the two styles of cooking was that one mixed all the vegetables together with the meat while the other kept the vegetables separately. Both were great tho and a delight. I appreciate the owner's attentiveness and it seems like he really cares a lot about taking care of his customers and educating them about wine. I look forward to coming here for some future wine tastings
Great wine!! Evenly peachy and lychee sweet. Very friendly owner and awesome environment for friends! Will definitely come back to check out their unique selection of wines!!

This wine bar is legit! Coming from California and just randomly walked into the wine bar. The owner got style and knows so much history/story of each wine he recommends or presents to you. It's a cozy wine bar. Great to come with friends. You can also call in advance to make reservations. They have interesting fingerfood choices too! Korean to Brazilian specialty. I was asking the owner what type of wine they have and they do have a lot of rare Portugal wine that's not around NYC as much. In the food menu, it shows which wine it can pair up nicely with too! Thought that was nice and convenient. I definitely recommend this place. The logo is so cute too. Nice slight vintage interior. Great drinks and food! Took some pics for those that might be interested in checking this place out!

Gomi all day everyday. Honestly such an untapped gem in e. village. I am so lucky to live right down the street from a reliable happy hour and amazing food. I ALWAYS get the yuca cheese balls no matter what! My recommendation is to order your food first and then just ask Rafael for a wine suggestion - he will not do you wrong!! You can tell this restaurant is such a labor of love for Rafael, and his energy and smile are infectious and you are sure to leave happy and full!!

Authentic Korean food in east village, very high quality considered its price. Even offered us free rosé towards the end of our brunch. Grilled corn very tasty.

As a Korean person living in East Village, I always passed here and wanted to go. Finally got a chance to go, and was disappointed. The drinks are just okay. They serve a large variety of wines and beers, and they have also flavored makgeoli. But, the food is actually so underwhelming. The cheese ddeobokki was terrible, and the fish cake soup (odeng) was even worse. The rice cakes were not cooked evenly, and the soup was tasteless. Always wondered why they were so empty even on Friday nights, and now I get why. If they made an effort to make their food better, I would try again. Until then, not really recommended.

I attended the Tour De France wine tasting and cheese pairing here last month, and I loved every wine selected (there were 2 sparkling, 2 white and 2-3 red), and greatly enjoyed learning about where each wine originated from and the types of grapes each are made from. They were generous with the pour, offering a full glass on each wine being introduced. The sommelier leading the tasting is from southern France and spoke knowledgeably about each wine and its creation. After 6-7 glasses of wine, I decided to order a few items from the food menu including the broccoli rabe and the polenta, which were both delicious! I will be returning for next month's wine tour and am looking forward to expanding my wine palate!

The cordial atmosphere is always a good start when you enter to an unfamiliar place. On top of that, what accentuates the good feeling is the wine they recommend you. Chef Raf there recommends you lots of different wines to go with the different foods he gives to you to stimulate your taste buds. A fusion restaurant that mixes Brazilian and Korean is an unique blend. On top of that it mixes wine with all of this. How many restaurants do you know that does this? I can finally say that I've found another go to bar when I need a comfortable place to hang out, eat, and drink. There's only a few of that here that makes me feel like home. Go to Gomi and try out the foods for yourself and ask for the suggestions of what wine to pair with it. Share this place with your friends. Mingle with the chef and leave this place as you've made more friends from this restaurant.

I came here with my husband two weeks ago. The service here was quite good, and we received a nice cheese plate. However, apart from that, the menu was kind of weird -- and the food was pretty bland. The cheese was served with what felt like microwave pita. The bulgogi needed much more salt -- I asked for it without oyster sauce because of my shellfish allergy, but that doesn't excuse the lack of flavor in my eyes. The pork wrap appetizer was pretty good. Overall, I wouldn't come back here, but if you live in the area, this place is quite cheap and has a good vibe.

Thanks Gomi for being our Christmas Day savior . When most of the restaurants were either closed or over booked we decided to venture into this almost empty restaurant on cold Christmas evening .It was an almost perfect albeit odd Christmas spot. The food was hearty and tasty. The rice water tea was soothing and the staff was very friendly and welcoming . Would highly recommend the seafood pancake and picanha fatiada.
Ate here last night and everything was delicious! This is 100% getting added to my list of regular spots in the East Village. Do yourself a favor and get the steak. YUM!

My new favorite brunch place!! I was craving good Korean food early on a sunday and theu delivered above and beyond. 10$ for a delicious dry pot and a mimosa, but my biggest suprise was to find so many brazilian options that i can't get many other places in the city. Coxinhas and pão de queijo!!! i can't recommend this place enough.

Probably shouldn't have gone here since I'm not a drinker, but I made a commitment. So you should probably read my review with a grain of salt. The chicken wings were too sweet and a little burned (which was also the case with the bread they served). The other dishes were all just okay: charcuterie, Korean seafood pancake, Thin cut spicy pork, Top sirloin cap, Spicy seafood ramen, Cheese plate.

Came here for brunch and left very unsatisfied with my meal. Staff is very friendly and accommodating but despite the restaurant being marketed for Korean food, nothing about the spicy chicken and bulgogi brunch specials tasted of Korean origin. This was one of those meals that left me feeling i could've made this better at home. Would be willing to come back, but definitely not for those dishes

This is a family run place and it's easy to tell it's a labor of love.  The food is delicious home cooking, mostly Korean with some Latin touches, the wines are reasonably priced and carefully chosen, and overall we're lucky to have such a nice spot within easy walking distance of our home!
First time here yesterday. As advertised. $10 for a dish served with rice , kimchi and veggies...and free glass of mimosa. The staff was accommodating plus a great ambiance!

This is such a cute neighborhood restaurant! Came here for the weekend brunch special and had the spicy seafood ramen with gyoza. The dishes were amazing and the owner is so friendly - will definitely be making this a regular dining experience!

Just stopped in today for some small bites and a beer. Was really excited to see a new restaurant in this location! I had some gyoza (great) and spicy wings (awesome). Really solid craft beer list, which you won't find at many Korean restaurants. The wine menu looks good too. Will definitely be back soon for dinner!
Excellent food and wine menu. Raphael is an incredibly warm and attentive host. Loved his wine pairings for our meal. Will definitely return soon!

Addictively delicious and unique food served with the same love and care as your own mother. The wine list has real breadth, depth, and personality. I've been here twice and will definitely make this a regular on my food circuit.
Really wanted to love it. And service was 10/5 but the food just wasn't the amazingness I'd hoped it would be. Just for the service, I'd give them a second try.

We stumbled upon this tapas bar in east village 2 nights ago and finished 3 bottles of wine. First gathering with new friends which was good too. The owner is a Brazilian-Korean-American or Korean-Brazilian-American, super nice and knowledgable of wines, all the wines he suggested hit the spot (trust me, I lived in Paris for 3 years!) - he gave us different kinds in between so practically more than 3 bottles. After that much wine (I still remember waitress asking us back, "another BOTTLE?") and 4+ main dishes the bill was around $210, which is not bad. Restaurant was supposed to close the door at 12 midnight, then open for us until 1:30 a.m. (Don't expect them to do that all the times though). I'd love to meet the new Korean friend again who happens to live in Stuyvesant nearby. Maybe we will.

This place has the best wine selection around. And the owner can make spot-on recommendations if you tell him what you like. It's a really sweet neighborhood place.

A wonderful unassuming restaurant, from the Korean pancake to start, incredible broccoli, soup, then protein offerings of short ribs, beef, tofu, the list goes on. There were seven of us, and I think we tried a dozen dishes, all flavored perfectly, a rare find. This gem is a bit out of the way, and well worth it.
Excellent find!! I stumbled upon this place, and am pleasantly surprised. From thegyoza, to the seafood pancake, to the charcuterie,  everything was great. A definite must visit!!

This is the best brunch place I've been to!!!! The owner is so nice and you get free mimosa with a full delicious meal for only 10 bucks! They randomly gave out tapas on the house and the customer service is awesome. I strongly recommend this place to everyone who is looking for a place to hang on weekends!
The best place to have an amazing wine and fusion Korean/ Brazilian pairing food. Raphael is a passiaont and very kind chef who offered us many great suggestions!
Get the corn cheese on skillet as appetizer and a glass of wine. Simple and classy. If you are looking for an entree, highly recommend the Cornish hen!

I finally tried out this quaint little restaurant for brunch. Their $10 brunch and free mimosa did not disappoint. I tried their bulgogi brunch special. It came with a bowl of rice, small dish of kimchi and a hot platter of meat and veggies. The mimosa was the right amount of fruity that I barely tasted the alcohol which is what I like to have since I'm not big on drinking. The kimchi was well fermented and yummy. The hot platter had a lot of meat. I was afraid I couldn't finish it. But I did my best and ate everything. I had a taste of the Korean rice cake for free which was just ok. The music was soft and the environment was nice and peaceful. Perfect for those of us who just goes out to eat by ourselves because we want to.

Gomi, Korean wine bar, NYE party host, bringer of copious amounts of red wine (3 glasses I think but maybe Dave Liao has a tally), roast meat and veggies, soju, champagne & yes, fried barley with kimchi. I didn't even know people made fried barley. Scallion pancakes and a glass noodle dish round out a night of debauchery (well behaved debauchery). Just go. Don't ask me how I got home I'm not sure I remember.

We had a fantastic experience here on a Friday night. We ended up eating bits and pieces like tapas while we forged on bottles and bottles of premium wines, which the owner helped us to choose, by serving tasters and giving us stories about why he selected the wines. We ended up rolling out of here very happy and inebriated an hour after closing, all having a very enjoyable experience of this place. I highly recommend it especially if you get to to chat with the owner while having dinner. Also love the relaxed vibe. Very clean place too.

Rafael, his staff, the food, and the wine: Gomi is an absolute gem of a place here in NYC. There is true warmth, passion, and generosity coming from Rafael, and I have been so impressed by his deep knowledge of wines from all over (and so decently priced!!). My friend and I decided upon Gomi as the place where we would hold our party celebrating our first books, and Rafael was just a joy to work with.  The food was wonderful and the drinks were terrific - it was a beautiful event and the space was perfect, and I have to thank Rafael and his staff for setting the atmosphere of relaxation, enjoyment, and celebration so well for us.  Gomi also has some pretty amazing special events (some concerning oysters - which I'm absolutely going to check out), so definitely be on the lookout.  If you go, I might be there already at the bar, trying out a new wine that Rafael has recommended!

Excellent wine selection, the atmosphere is relaxed & intimate. I tried the seafood pancake & gyoza and both were really tasty! Great after work spot for a glass of wine & a light bite - cheers!

The menu was superb and accommodated allergies (I'm gluten free). They also gave us complimentary wine to pair with our dinner. 100% will go back and bring friends!! :)
Cozy spot for getting together with friends or a date night. Not overly loud so you can have a conversation. Highly recommend their Rose.
Lovely space! The owner is a seasoned traveler with a passion for wine and good food. Great happy hour. I recommend the yuca bread, which is also gluten free.
We came here for their weekday brunch and had an amazing experience! Delicious food, mimosas, and a great atmosphere. Will definitely be coming back!

Utterly loved this place! My Korean stepmom and I went here for a snack before proper dinner: she adored that not only the servers spoke fluent Korean, BUT, the cleanness and attention to detail of this spot is unheard of in East Village. I cannot recommend highly enough!

Wow I scored walking into this place looking for healthy food and Organic tasty wine!  I can't have gluten and the owner/made me the best tofu veggie soup gluten free while I enjoyed a delicious Organic Bordeaux.  It's difficult to find quality healthy food made without additives. I highly recommend!.
Amazingly affordable brunch! It is also lovely for dinner - great wine list. The owner is really great and very friendly - everyone seemed to know him when they came in to eat.

We live in the area and have come for brunch a few times now. The food has alway been great and the service is friendly. The food is mostly Korean dishes but uses some Brazilian ingredients that make it special. They also have some Brazilian dishes on the menu. I would highly recommend the spicy pork belly skillet and the pão de queijo. The brunch prices also can't be beat for the East Village

The food is wonderful but the wine list is mind blowing. The owner, Rafael, is a gift to NYC. His passion exudes in ever dish I tried. I can't wait to come back.

This place is amazing ! The food is so fresh and the owner is extremely knowledgeable about wine! I constantly crave the spicy chicken and veggies, it's so delicious ! The vibe is also really cool! Great atmosphere !

What a gem! I went to Gomi for brunch with a friend on Sat. Food was very satisfying, and the owner was both hospitable and knowledgable. The venue also hosts many interesting events, such as free sake/wine tasting, so do definitely check its website for regular updates!

Raphael is a genius- and super sweet. This is a great place to come for a drink and a bite if you are female and want to go out alone. The food rocks the vibe is relaxed and the people are friendly (but not too friendly). I feel totally at home and comfortable here. Yay!

Hidden gem. Hands down one of the best restaurants in NYC. Their service and food are both incredible, but their wine selection makes this place that much better. I've had many types of wines but the ones I've tried at gomi via the owner's recommendations were by far better than any other. I believe they special order their wines from South America and their selections are unavailable anywhere else. The wine and food pairings are perfection and I can't say enough good things about this place. Also a really great place for big parties, which is so hard to find in the city.
Nice guy but disappointed with the service. Ive been a few times and the food is pretty good but its a very empty and slow place.
The food was average. They didn't seem to have much knowledge or selection for a "wine bar". There also seemed to be a lot of flies hovering around.

This was not a great restaurant. The only reason it gets two stars is because it was clean and the staff was generally friendly. I had to continually ask for more water. And it was not like the place was crowded - they only had one person working the floor. Our order came out completely backwards. Our entrees came out prior to our appetizers. All of the food was just OK. the bulgogi was very fatty and not even that hot. The chicken wings were not well done and the flavor was...interesting? The spicy ramen was horrible. They used freeze dried shrimp and calamari which is absolutely disgusting. The mussels had a very strong sea flavor - which they should not if they are fresh. It truly looked like the microwavable ramen noodles (I wouldn't be surprised if this is what they used). Our waitress completely forgot one of the menu items. But, since we did not enjoy the food we didn't even bother to ask about it. Definitely skip this place.

Gomi is a very welcoming, family-run restaurant. The owner, who is also the bartender and chef and dishwasher and server (!) was beyond friendly and hospitable. Gomi is a great place to visit for great wine. My party and I dined here for dinner on a Saturday night. We really enjoyed the seafood pancake, which was perfectly doughy with nice crispy layers. My mom and I shared the Cornish hen (btw takes about 30 minutes), which was plenty for the two of us (with a side) after all of the appetizers we shared. The hen was cooked perfectly, very juicy and tender, I just wish it was a little more seasoned. I didn't eat the chicken wings, but everyone else enjoyed them. I also tried the bulgogi and the Brazilian sirloin - the sirloin was okay, the bulgogi was very tasty and had a lot of flavor. The side of broccolini was delicious and a huge portion. Actually, the portions of all of the dishes were huge and would be great for sharing. I definitely recommend Gomi!
Visited about a month ago. I'm from Chicago and stopped in and was greeted to great hospitality and really great wine for a good price. Much recommended!

We really enjoyed a little happy hour snack here. There were several seating options, including a couch style bench w cozy pillows. We enjoyed some happy hour prices wine ($7/glass) and the bartender kindly offered a recommendation when I didn't particularly love the first pour. We had a cheese plate and corn appetizer. The latter was okay, but we did enjoy the cheese and bread. It was quiet at 5 - we were the only customers at that time. I asked for an empty to-go cup and they did not have any disposable but were super sweet and gave me a small Sam Adams glass to go!
This place is a strange mix of Asian and western food. There were flies when we dined so I'm worried their sanity level.
Lovely Gem in LES! Really nice wine selections, delicious food and fair pricing. Who could ask for more? Keep it up!! I'll definitely be back. Nice job folks

Came here for a light meal and stayed for the wines!  Initially wanted to order two different types of wines with friends so we can try them both, but owner was kind enough to offer tastings so we could order what we actually enjoyed.  All the wines we ended up having were delish.  Owner definitely knows his stuff so don't be afraid to ask for recommendations, he'd be more than happy to help you choose.
Went here from brunch recently. Really cool vibe. Fantastic food and incredibly affordable brunch. Solid Korean dishes with large portions. Comes with free mimosa! Owner super friendly and nice.

We had our organization's Holiday Party at Gomi and it was fantastic.  The food is delicious, the wine selection incredible and the staff very accommodating.  We had a great time and already want to book for next year!
Went to a friends birthday for tapas and drinks. Great selection of wine and the food was delicious!

Came here on a Monday night. The food was wonderful - can't find any problem. The owner is a real food and wine lover himself. We got a complimentary wine and dish. Terrific place. Will come back often.
Food is absolutely delicious, and the service is quick and caring. Brunch is very reasonably priced too for what you get. Love this place! So happy they're in the neighborhood :)
The attention was excellent, we got on point recommendations about the wine and the food was delicious. Will definitely come back!
A cute gem in east village! The $10 brunch is unbeatable, with a free glass of mimosa. Lovely ambiance and Rafael is really the nicest person ever.

column6: This is a solid stop for drinks and ogling at bros. If that's your thing, pop in. I have only stopped in during a week night and it's just enough--no line.

I was really excited to try this restaurant after hearing great things, so i decided to go with 3 friends during the afternoon for cocktails and lunch. When we arrived, we were sat in a booth, and no one came over to our table for 15 minutes (and it was not crowded!). When we finally ordered our drinks, we did not get them for another 30 min, and the server never asked if we wanted food. At this point, we also noticed another couple sitting at the bar who also was not getting any service who ultimately decided to get up and leave. When our drinks finally arrived, some of them were spilled on the table without any apology (or napkins) and these are quite expensive ($18) drinks. The draft espresso martini was not good at all. We finished our drinks and by then no one had ever come back to our table. After another 30 min or so, we ultimately had to go find someone who works there and ask them to please bring our check. At no point were we ever asked if we wanted any food, any other drinks, or really anything. It was one of the worst service experiences I've had at any restaurant.

Have been here a few times and have loved every single moment. For starters, the bar is gorgeous, the bartenders are knowledgeable, and there's a wide selection of whiskeys. Our server, Michael, really made our visit special. He recommended some great starters and drinks. He was so attentive even with it being very busy that night. He made sure all our food came out quickly and that our cups weren't empty!!

The 'dinner menu' is overpriced greasy bar food - think white bread soaked in burnt grease and that pretty much sums it up. If you want to chug some beers and fries with your frat bros and watch the game this is your spot but there is nothing elegant or refined about this bar.
