Good bar! Love the decor and ambiance, and the drinks and service are good. Not too many tables but if you get there early you should be okay. Great drink selection and decent prices.

Terrible experience. Native New Yorker and have been many times. Bouncer "Prince" was rude and unprofessional on 2/14/2020. Definitely will not go back. I was cut off at the door. Wait time was over 30min.

The configuration of the seating is terrible. No private booths or tables. Ribeye hash has four morsels of delicious meat , and is potato overload. Not worth $21.00 , mixed cocktails aren't cheap, and very light on alcohol. Smash-burger is fabulous, but a smidgen overpriced. Hand cut fries are fabulous. You must maneuver a  dimly lit staircase to the bathrooms, which are spotless. Service is excellent.
Don't go here if you don't have an authentic spine to share with the other real people. Keeping bartenders with accents never hurts. Good chill vibe which is what I was looking for. I will return.

My new favorite bar and restaurant. I have found my new neighborhood spot! They have the best burger I've had in my life, coolest ambiance, great crowd, hip, classic, unpretentious, food and cocktails done right!

Great selection of scotch and superb drink list. Mosquito cocktail was great. Space is well setup with enough space for large groups or a more intimate date. Food was killer - burger, lobster toast, onion rings are must haves!
Fantastic bar food and even better cocktails. Fun, upbeat ambiance. With any luck, in your drink will be made by Kristin, the Spaniard's best bartender.
No comment
No comment

Stopped in for a beer before checking into our AirBNB. Great cocktails, inventive menu. What a great space to unwind and enjoy. Knowledgable bar tender steered us in the right direction. Will be back for food later. A must stop in the West Village.

Food was really good pub fare, but honestly this place way way too sceney. The back room was less crowded but the whole restaurant had a sort of clubby feel. Kind of disappointing for a place focused on whiskey and comfort food.

I came by for a couple of drinks with a friend on late Saturday night. The place was packed with a decent looking yuppy crowd (some vineyard wines Bros in golf shirts took away from the looks). Given it was pretty packed it took a while to order drinks. There was a cocktail menu but I ended up sticking to a vodka soda. The decor is pretty nice and cozy. There is a dining room in the back that was also full. The bartenders poured generously and this seems like a long term mainstay in the West Village. I have walked by during Brunch and it seems pretty packed. Might come back to check it out again.
Good Food and drinks in a really pleasant atmosphere.  As you can see from my picture the decor includes huge mirror !

This is a lovely bar - great design and space. However, you have to *fight* to get a drink here and it is very much a "scene." It gets crowded very quickly and it is not a good place to relax, and because it gets loud - it's not the best to catch up with friends either in my opinion. The wine was only ok.
Packed bar on a Friday night and a little expensive, but definitely a fun atmosphere with an excellent crowd.
No comment

This place is a great addition to West 4th--I went within their first week of opening and was impressed by how smoothly everything was running.  I've worked in hospitality and I'm big on customer service.  Arielle was my bartender my first time there, she made me a delish custom cocktail and had great energy behind the bar. I've gone back a couple times since and she remembered me and my drink--something I appreciate and will definitely make me a regular!
The Smash Burger is only $13 is good for the soul, and The Santiago cocktail was delicious.

Chris B was the bartender and he treated us terribly. I told him that it was my roommates 21st birthday to see if he had any recommendations for her first legal drink. He then proceeded to check all of our IDs intensely, even though we had already gone through a bouncer at the front door. He made a point to be a jerk. Crappy experience, and upsetting that a bartender that would be such a jerk especially on my friends special day.
PJ Calapa has done it again!  Great food, amazing hand crafted drinks - all placed in a historic location in NYC's West Village.  Go check it out - you won't be disappointed!

Really nice looking place inside, cocktails were great and the food I had was pretty good. I was pretty busy the Thursday that I was there, which is a good sign that other people feel the same as I do. Looks like there is a lot of standing room by the bar and some separate areas for groups.

Great ambience and fantastic drinks. I had the penicillin, which was excellent. Really can't go wrong with any drink on the menu, as I also tried the toucan, rosemary Manhattan and mosquito. Will definitely be back to try more!
Absolutely awful. Food is so bad and drinks were gross. Don't go here. Way better bars and restaurants in west village

This is a great bar. Big, beautiful interior. Lots of soft, diffused dim lighting. The tall brick vaulted ceilings make the whole room feel open. The bar also wraps around the entire room which connects everything nicely. This is a classic bar. There were a ton of people, but it didn't feel to big or crowded.
A favorite!  Went for the drinks, fell into the food... so good.  Tell them Thom sent ya, just kidding, don't do that.
It's got a nice vibe. Drinks are good. Food is extremely average. One of those places where you could go if you happen to be in the area. Wouldn't make deliberate plans to go here though.

Incredible atmosphere, a great bar, and interesting/delicious food! I love coming here with a big group of friends and sitting in the back room. Their cocktails are creative and fantastic. They also have a great draft list. They have vegetarian options and their fries are the perfection companion to their drinks. It can get a little busy on the weekends, but I've always had a fantastic time there. The staff is efficient, kind, and extremely knowledgeable. I'm always looking for an excuse to come back.
The latest establishment to take over this location is definitely my favorite so far. good food, good drinks, good service, good vibe. great looking people come here ;)

Came here on a Thursday night after work with a friend and it was crowded, but not too crowded. We put our names down for a table (45 minute wait), but they texted us after about 10 minutes that they had a table ready. I tried the Toucan and The Fix Is In, both of which were refreshing and not too strong. The ambience was extremely trendy (such cute velvet barstools) and everyone there seemed to be having a great time. The fries were also super thick and delicious. Highly recommend and will be back for date night or a night out with friends!

I dined at this restaurant last night with a friend. The burger (3.25/5) did not meet expectations, but was not terrible. The burger had two patties and a perfect char to it, the bun was nice crisp and buttery. However, the quality of the meat and the price point bring it down. Price at $14 without fries (you can purchase fries extra for $8). The ambiance and the duck wings (5/5) are the reason for my 4 star rating. The duck wings ($15) were outstanding and some of the best wings that I have had in the city. Do not miss on these! The ambiance was fun, dark, and trendy and the music playing was not too loud to be able to have a conversation. We did not drink but prices of wine were on the higher end - there was one for $12 and the rest for $14-16.

Wish I could give this place anything more than one star.... but the bouncer ruined it for the place! Literally had 20 mins before close(and I get it Im a bartender) but all I wanted was a shot(super quick) and the bathroom... wouldn't take long, and I'd be out well before four! He actually put his hands on me... not cool!!! Again, quick shot and done should have not been an issue considering they had pretty much a full bar. Not cool guys. Talk to your bouncer!
No comment
All the things you like about Wilfie but twice as big. Awesome whiskey selection. Great small plates.
Best burger in NYC. The food is amazing but definitely not diet-friendly... If you don't need healthy options and want delicious food, this place is for you. And the service was EXCELLENT.

Another wonderful place in the village. The first time I went was for brunch and it was wonderful. The space they are in is beautiful and they really designed the interior well. They make their own chips for the brunch nachos so that was unique and very tasty. Also had the burger and it was really good.
Couldn't really get a clear vibe. The location was perfect, but I felt the food and drinks were over priced.

Great spot. Classy but not pretentious. Fun but not fratty. Food is plus and very reasonable but known for original drinks and great bartenders, like Arielle, who know your drink and keep you coming back.

If I could give 0 stars I would. Place wasn't even packed and the person who works there kept telling us where we were allowed to stand. Then he proceeded to start yelling and aggressively gesturing his hands in my face when I was standing in a corner because (according to him) if I didn't sit down in the table he was going to get fired. Please know that I weigh a 100 lbs and don't occupy much space. He literally ran us out if that place. Do yourself a favor and spend your money elsewhere.

I came to The Spaniard with a friend and loved the vibe and the crowd. Our bartender was on point with our drink and food menu. I feel in love with the place b/c our bartender (Arielle) made the place welcoming and she sure knows how to make some stiff drinks!!! This is my to go place from now on. Thanks Arielle!!! See you soon.
Awesome baristas! They have freaking amazing cocktails here! I have yet to try the food so I will update my review once I try the food there which I also heard was really good.

Was treated with total disrespect. Shuffled around the bar so they can constantly let more and more people in.  Someone even physically touched me to try and move me to a different spot. I was not disrupting anyone.  This place is pathetic. Don't go at all. So many more better spots in NYC to visit.

This is the worst service in the village. There's a female bartender there with glasses who clearly needs a new career path. She was rude to us and a party that was separate from us. They wrote a comment on their bill about how she needed an attitude change. Wish we did the same. I hope she reads this so she finds something more solitary, like a librarian in an unpopular book section. Girl sucks.

My first time here I thought the Smash Burger was one of the greatest burgers I've ever had.  The second time I came was later at night on Friday, turns out the place gets a bit clubby and doesn't server food at around this time.  The second time I actually got a burger here it was only alright.  I guess the burger is kind of hit or miss.  The onion rings aren't my favorite here, they're very heavily battered.  That might be your thing or not.  Overall, if you can get the burger the way I had it the first time, I would highly recommend this place.

The food was great and our waitress was really friendly. Great: the charbroiled oysters, the Porter House steak for two, the chopped salad, and the old-fashioned I had after (perfect). I dropped it a star because it was really loud.
Just stopped in for drinks on MDW. The green Bloody Mary was absurdly good...highly recommend. Nice ambiance and friendly staff... will be back!
Loved this place! Absolutely the best new spot in the whole of Manhattan! history of this amazing bar. Ecelent drinks and exquisite food

I really wanted to like this place as I've heard great things. Went with a group of 6 for brunch. We talked about how bad this place was for the rest of the day. The food over priced but not terrible. Burger was super average maybe even below average. My friend paid $15 for avocado toast which was literally 1 small piece of toast with avocado on it. Another friend was charged $4 to substitute the ham on her eggs Benedict with avocado (she is vegetarian). Meaning they took the most expensive ingredient out, replaced it with a cheaper one, and charged 4 extra dollars ! SMH. Also the service was terrible. Had to flag the waitress down to order more drinks, took forever to get them once ordered, but then when her shift was ending she kept coming over to rush us out. I would happily pay the prices for quality food, service drinks etc. But this was deff not that. The best thing this place has going is location and good ambiance,  crowd.

Went here for my gf's friend's birthday dinner. Its more of a bar than restaurant and gets packed on weekend nights. In fact, on the side we were on, I think we were the only ones ordering food. I think i would suggest somehow separating the tables more from the people at the bar because it just gets so packed, folks kept putting their dirty glasses on our table.  However, aside from that, the food and service was excellent. First a word on the service-I was pleasantly surprised at how friendly everyone on the staff was.  When places like this get really crowded, sometimes the staff can take their frustrations out on the customer when they need to get by etc. Here, just the opposite. Everyone was very courteous. Props to management for that.   As far as the food,  the burger is on the top burgers in NYC list and my gf and I have been gradually checking them all out.  The Spaniard's "Smash Burger" deserves to be on the list.  Its sort of like a fast food style burger but more gourmet. We also enjoyed the drinks and sides we had as well. I had the Penicillin and it had a nice kick to it.   So really not a bad word to say and nothing wrong with being crowded-it means you're a popular spot.  I guess the best compromise would be to go, order a drink at the bar (instead of sitting in a booth) and get the burger. You have to try both.

Was looking for a nice spot to go to with a few of my friends and we stumbled upon the Spaniard. Although it was busy, the service was still phenomenal. My drink was never empty! Plus the food was fantastic and everything was reasonably priced which is a plus, will definitely be coming back soon.

Decent spot, but WAY too crowded on Friday and Saturday nights. I've been here a few times during the weekdays and enjoyed it, but weekends it gets crazy crowded and you'll have to fight your way past the crowds to get a drink. Place is good, but not good enough to be worthy of dealing with being packed like sardines. Would return on a weekday when crowds are less

Absolutely love this bar/restaurant!!! The food is so good, not your typical bar food. The drinks are also tasty. They get really creative here. I've gone there 3 times and had the same bartender, Arielle. She is the best bartender,  super informative and energetic! I highly recommend checking this place out.
Great place, delicious cocktails, and Arielle is a super-duper bartender!
Great atmosphere for lunch, Smashburger was very good ribeye sandwich was excellent and shrimp Caesar salad was very good. Alex the waiter was very friendly

The hostess this Saturday night was extremely rude to me and my friends. We had heard good things about this place and wanted to come and take a look. She spoke to us in a very degrading tone and just did not treat us with kindness or respect. I understand working on a Saturday night at a crowded bar is stressful, but we deserved the benefit of the doubt, which she in no way gave us. There is a way to do your job and still maintain human decency. Sadly will not be returning.
I got the chance to try the Smash Burger at the NYCWFF Burger Bash and it was a great classic cheeseburger.
Terrible service. Obnoxious bouncers.  Good location, but hopefully will go out of business like the place before it to make way for a better bar

I think this is the most awesome (and accidentally found place) I have tried for 4 days in NYC. On our last evening in NYC, my husband and I wanted to go out for drinks & dinner. This place was nearby that other place where we played pool plus it had a pretty good reviews on Yelp. Well, what can I say? Very nice atmosphere, clean place and friendly service. The bartender was amazing (I think his name was Keron). I ordered duck wings with some cocktail the name of which I don't even remember, but it was a good one. My husband ordered a sandwich and a beer (he said it was pretty good for this type of place and for this price). What really amazed me, is that that bartender did everything in his power to satisfy us and he did it not because he should have, but because he wanted to! Look, I got used to eat carrots along with any wings I order at any place, but this place served only celery. I asked Keron if it's possible to order carrots and he said he will take care of it for me. Only later I learned that they don't actually serve carrots. Is not that amazing service? He provided us with an extremely great service and had a cool personality! Oh, btw ... we met this Irish guy whose name was Ronin and they seem to know each other for a while. Those two guys definitely made our evening unforgettable. Thanks guys! I wish I could rate u 10 starts!!!!

We came in last night for a drink and quick bite to eat with my husband as we have heard so many great things about the Spaniard and we were not disappointed!!! The bar was busy and most tables were sat but it was a nice mellow Sunday evening crowd, upon entering we were warmly greeted by the hostess who seated us and brought over water as we settled in. Our server Alex was so friendly and helpful with his recommendations! We ended up getting a chicken club and a smash burger which he had said were two of the most popular choices and we can see why!! The burger was like a gourmet take of a Bigmac but with real meat! The chicken club was by far the best we have ever had!!! There is a great range of house cocktails and a whiskey list to die for!! The manager Patrick came over to check in and see how everything was going, he was great answering all our questions about the best times to come and recommending some cocktails to try! As we were leaving everyone wished us well and we left appreciating what amazing service we had as its far and few between in NY!!! We will definitely be back very soon!!
Great place for a date with my husband on a weeknight.  Brought our newborn and nobody batted an eye. Really delicious cocktails. Expensive but exquisite! Good service too.
Came here for date night and must say that the food was amazing! I just wish they toned down the music and make it into a real whiskey cocktail bar instead of trying to be a fist pumping place

Seems like a cool spot upon entry. However the hostess did not approach us, as she was having a personal conversation with another girl. We walked over to her and she looked at my father  and said "Can i help you, like do you need something?" in a very rude and condescending way. I was stunned... She also had the nerve to ask my sister "is he okay" as if he was being the rude one. we did end up sitting down and when we realized the very minimal menu was not what we were looking for, we left. will definitely never return.

I grew up in NY and recently was in town visiting family. I hadn't been to the West Village in ages and hoped to find a spot with solid cocktails and tasty food. The Spaniard blew me away. The decor is gorgeous, there is beautiful woodwork and lovely accents. I am a bit of a cocktail snob and I was very impressed with the rosemary manhattan (or two) that I had while I was there. We ordered a number of appetizers and some entrees to share, and I loved my experience there. I look forward to going back next time I am in the area.

We were visiting from London. Great bar and vibe. Duck wings are the best things I've ever tasted! Would also recommend the oysters and the onion rings. My compliments to the chef! Would definitely recommend!
Don't let the hype fool you. Shake shack makes a better burger for half the price. Average at best.
They don't use their air conditioner when it's hot and humid out.  Not sure why a restaurant would choose to not do that.  Otherwise it's a great spot, just wait until it's winter.

Great food and nice service! Considering it's "bar food" served at 2 AM, it was pretty delicious. Where else can you get steak frites & an heirloom tomato salad that late? Cocktails were good (but too strong for me). Music was also extremely good!
The lunch special was fantastic, especially the chicken club. The bartender and server , Danielle and Jamie , was phenomenal in all of her recommendations. Great drinks, great food, great atmosphere!
